questions.question: Which local government bodies function in urban areas?

options.text: Gram Panchayat, Panchayat Samiti, Zilla Parishad
Nagar Panchayat, Municipal Council, Municipal Corporation
Village Council, Taluka Council, District Council
Corporation Committee, State Council, City Board

questions.answer: Nagar Panchayat, Municipal Council, Municipal Corporation

questions.question: Which transformation trend is highlighted in the chapter?

options.text: Villages growing into towns and cities

questions.answer: Villages growing into towns and cities

questions.question: Which is NOT mentioned as an opportunity available in cities?
questions.answer: Abundant agricultural land

questions.question: Which of the following is identified as a major problem in cities?
questions.answer: Shortage of housing

questions.question: Which urban problem is directly related to road usage?
questions.answer: Traffic congestion

questions.question: Which issue results from inadequate waste management in cities?
questions.answer: Problem of disposal of waste

questions.question: Which local body governs areas that are neither fully rural nor fully urban?
questions.answer: Nagar Panchayat

questions.question: How frequently are elections held for a Nagar Panchayat?
questions.answer: Every five years

questions.question: Who is selected from among the elected members of a Nagar Panchayat?
questions.answer: President and Vice-President

questions.question: Which local government body functions in small cities?
questions.answer: Municipal Council

questions.question: What is the term used for elected representatives of the Municipal Council?
questions.answer: Councillors

questions.question: Who presides over the meetings of the Municipal Council?
questions.answer: President

questions.question: Which function is compulsory for the Municipal Council?
questions.answer: Providing drinking water

questions.question: Which of the following is a discretionary function of the Municipal Council?
questions.answer: Creating public parks

questions.question: Who is responsible for implementing decisions of the Municipal Council?
questions.answer: Chief Officer

questions.question: Which local body provides services in big cities?
questions.answer: Municipal Corporation

questions.question: Where was the first Municipal Corporation in Maharashtra established?
questions.answer: Mumbai

questions.question: Who is the administrative head of a Municipal Corporation?
questions.answer: Municipal Commissioner

questions.question: Who prepares the annual budget of the Municipal Corporation?
questions.answer: Municipal Commissioner

questions.question: Who are the elected members of the Municipal Corporation called?
questions.answer: Corporators

questions.question: Who is known as the first citizen of the city?
questions.answer: Mayor

questions.question: Where are major decisions regarding city development taken?

options.text: General Body meeting of the Corporation

questions.answer: General Body meeting of the Corporation

questions.question: Which committee deals with matters related to education?
questions.answer: Education Committee

questions.question: Which service is directly related to emergency response?
questions.answer: Fire Brigade

questions.question: Which function involves issuing construction permissions?
questions.answer: Permission for construction

questions.question: Which function involves action against illegal buildings?
questions.answer: Demolition of unauthorized construction

questions.question: Which tax is levied on property owners by urban local bodies?
questions.answer: Property Tax

questions.question: Which source adds revenue through public amusement activities?
questions.answer: Entertainment Tax

questions.question: Which tax is collected for water-related services?
questions.answer: Water Tax

questions.question: Which revenue source involves borrowing funds?
questions.answer: Raising loans

questions.question: Which authority inspects weighing scales in markets?
questions.answer: Municipal Corporation

questions.question: Which body modernises fire brigade services?
questions.answer: Municipal Corporation

questions.question: Which programme aims to control diseases like dengue?
questions.answer: Health programmes of the Corporation

questions.question: Which local body takes decisions to protect the environment in cities?
questions.answer: Municipal Corporation

questions.question: Which factor determines the number of members in a Municipal Corporation?
questions.answer: Population of the city

questions.question: How often are Municipal Corporation elections held?
questions.answer: Every five years

questions.question: Which officer assists in implementing city development decisions?
questions.answer: Municipal Commissioner

questions.question: Which body is responsible for public transport in cities?
questions.answer: Municipal Corporation

questions.question: Which function includes providing information about dangerous buildings?
questions.answer: Municipal Corporation services

questions.question: Which service involves registering births and deaths?
questions.answer: Municipal Corporation

questions.question: Which body levies profession tax?
questions.answer: Municipal Corporation

questions.question: Which of the following is a source of revenue from the State Government?
questions.answer: Grants

questions.question: Which local body has a Mayor as its head?
questions.answer: Municipal Corporation

questions.question: Which official is equivalent to the executive head in a Nagar Panchayat?
questions.answer: Executive Officer

questions.question: Which local body has a minimum of 17 members?
questions.answer: Municipal Council

questions.question: Which local body has members proportional to city population?
questions.answer: Municipal Corporation

questions.question: Which post exists in all three urban local bodies?
questions.answer: Vice-President

questions.question: Why is reservation of seats necessary in urban local bodies?

options.text: To allow participation of deprived sections and women

questions.answer: To allow participation of deprived sections and women

questions.question: What proportion of seats are reserved for women?
questions.answer: Half of the seats

questions.question: What is the main purpose of reservation in a democracy?

options.text: To ensure participation of all sections in decision-making

questions.answer: To ensure participation of all sections in decision-making

questions.question: What change is observed in the pattern of settlements in India?
questions.answer: Villages are growing into towns, towns into cities, and cities into metropolises.

questions.question: Why are urban local government bodies becoming increasingly important?
questions.answer: They are important because towns and cities are growing rapidly and need organized administration.

questions.question: Name any two opportunities available in cities.
questions.answer: Opportunities for industry and business and large-scale employment opportunities.

questions.question: Mention any two problems commonly faced in cities.
questions.answer: Shortage of housing and traffic congestion.

questions.question: Why does traffic congestion become a serious problem in cities?
questions.answer: Traffic congestion increases due to limited road space and a large number of vehicles.

questions.question: What is meant by urban local government bodies?
questions.answer: Urban local government bodies are institutions that manage administration and services in urban areas.

questions.question: Which local body governs areas in transition from villages to towns?
questions.answer: The Nagar Panchayat governs areas that are in transition from villages to towns.

questions.question: How often are elections held for a Nagar Panchayat?
questions.answer: Elections to a Nagar Panchayat are held every five years.

questions.question: Who are elected as office bearers of a Nagar Panchayat?
questions.answer: The elected members choose a President and a Vice-President.

questions.question: Which local government body functions in small cities?
questions.answer: The Municipal Council functions in small cities.

questions.question: What are the elected members of a Municipal Council called?
questions.answer: The elected members of a Municipal Council are called Councillors.

questions.question: Who presides over the meetings of the Municipal Council?
questions.answer: The President presides over the meetings of the Municipal Council.

questions.question: What is the role of the Vice-President of the Municipal Council?
questions.answer: The Vice-President looks after the work of the Council in the absence of the President.

questions.question: What are obligatory functions of the Municipal Council?
questions.answer: They are functions that the Council must perform, such as providing drinking water and street lighting.

questions.question: Give one example of an obligatory function of the Municipal Council.
questions.answer: Registration of births, deaths and marriages.

questions.question: What are discretionary functions of the Municipal Council?
questions.answer: These are additional functions performed to provide extra facilities to citizens.

questions.question: Mention any one discretionary function of the Municipal Council.
questions.answer: Creating public gardens and parks.

questions.question: Who is the administrative head of the Municipal Council?
questions.answer: The Chief Officer is the administrative head of the Municipal Council.

questions.question: What is the main duty of the Chief Officer?
questions.answer: He implements the decisions taken by the Municipal Council.

questions.question: Which local body provides services in big cities?
questions.answer: The Municipal Corporation provides services in big cities.

questions.question: Where was the first Municipal Corporation in Maharashtra established?
questions.answer: The first Municipal Corporation in Maharashtra was established in Mumbai.

questions.question: Who is the administrative head of the Municipal Corporation?
questions.answer: The Municipal Commissioner is the administrative head of the Municipal Corporation.

questions.question: What is the responsibility of the Municipal Commissioner?
questions.answer: He implements the decisions of the Corporation and prepares the annual budget.

questions.question: Who are the elected members of the Municipal Corporation?
questions.answer: The elected members of the Municipal Corporation are called Corporators.

questions.question: Who is considered the first citizen of the city?
questions.answer: The Mayor is considered the first citizen of the city.

questions.question: What is the role of the Mayor in the Municipal Corporation?
questions.answer: The Mayor presides over meetings and represents the city.

questions.question: Where are important city development decisions discussed?
questions.answer: They are discussed in the General Body meeting of the Corporation.

questions.question: Why are committees formed in the Municipal Corporation?
questions.answer: Committees are formed to carry out specific functions efficiently.

questions.question: Name any one committee of the Municipal Corporation.
questions.answer: Education Committee.

questions.question: Mention any one service provided by the Municipal Corporation.
questions.answer: Water supply.

questions.question: Why is waste disposal an important urban function?
questions.answer: Proper waste disposal is essential to maintain cleanliness and public health.

questions.question: What role does the Municipal Corporation play in public health?
questions.answer: It implements programmes to control the spread of diseases.

questions.question: Why is fire brigade service important in cities?
questions.answer: It provides emergency response during fires and disasters.

questions.question: How does the Municipal Corporation regulate construction activities?
questions.answer: By granting permissions and demolishing unauthorized constructions.

questions.question: Why does the Municipal Corporation protect the environment?
questions.answer: To ensure sustainable development and a healthy living environment.

questions.question: What is the main source of income for urban local bodies?
questions.answer: Taxes collected from citizens are a major source of income.

questions.question: Name any one tax collected by the Municipal Corporation.
questions.answer: Property tax.

questions.question: What is meant by grants as a source of revenue?
questions.answer: Grants are funds provided by the State Government to local bodies.

questions.question: Why are loans raised by urban local bodies?
questions.answer: Loans are raised to fund large development projects.

questions.question: What is meant by reservation of seats?
questions.answer: Reservation of seats means allocating seats for specific social groups.

questions.question: Which groups are given reserved seats in urban local bodies?
questions.answer: Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, Backward Classes and women.

questions.question: What proportion of seats are reserved for women?
questions.answer: Half of the total seats are reserved for women.

questions.question: Why is reservation necessary in a democracy?
questions.answer: It ensures participation of deprived sections in decision-making.

questions.question: How does reservation empower women?
questions.answer: It provides women opportunities to participate in governance.

questions.question: What role do urban local bodies play in democracy?
questions.answer: They allow citizens to participate directly in local governance.

questions.question: Why is citizen participation important in urban governance?
questions.answer: It helps in better decision-making and accountability.

questions.question: How do urban local bodies improve quality of life?
questions.answer: By providing essential civic services and facilities.

questions.question: What is the significance of elections in urban local bodies?
questions.answer: Elections ensure democratic representation of citizens.

questions.question: Why is local self-government important in cities?
questions.answer: It enables local issues to be addressed efficiently.

questions.question: What overall role do urban local government bodies play?
questions.answer: They manage urban administration, services and development.

questions.question: Why is urban local self-government essential in rapidly growing cities?
questions.answer: Urban local self-government is essential because it enables timely management of civic services and addresses local urban problems effectively.

questions.question: How does urbanisation increase the responsibilities of local government bodies?
questions.answer: Urbanisation increases population density and demands for services, thereby expanding the responsibilities of urban local bodies.

questions.question: Why are Nagar Panchayats important in transitional areas?
questions.answer: They help manage areas changing from rural to urban by providing basic urban facilities and governance.

questions.question: How does the five-year election cycle strengthen democracy at the urban level?
questions.answer: It ensures regular public participation and accountability of elected representatives.

questions.question: Why is the division between small cities and big cities necessary for administration?
questions.answer: Different sizes of cities require different administrative structures to manage services efficiently.

questions.question: How do obligatory functions reflect the core duties of Municipal Councils?
questions.answer: They ensure essential services like water supply and sanitation are provided to all citizens.

questions.question: Why are discretionary functions important despite not being compulsory?
questions.answer: They improve the quality of urban life by providing additional amenities and facilities.

questions.question: How does the Chief Officer contribute to effective municipal administration?
questions.answer: By implementing decisions and ensuring smooth daily functioning of the Municipal Council.

questions.question: Why is the Municipal Corporation suitable for large cities?
questions.answer: Large cities require a stronger administrative system to manage complex urban services.

questions.question: How does the role of the Municipal Commissioner differ from that of the Mayor?
questions.answer: The Commissioner handles administration, while the Mayor performs ceremonial and leadership functions.

questions.question: Why is the Mayor called the first citizen of the city?
questions.answer: Because the Mayor represents the city and presides over important civic functions.

questions.question: How do General Body meetings influence city development?
questions.answer: They serve as platforms for discussion and decision-making on major urban issues.

questions.question: Why are specialised committees formed within Municipal Corporations?
questions.answer: To handle specific sectors such as education, health and transport efficiently.

questions.question: How do fire brigade services contribute to urban safety?
questions.answer: They provide rapid response during fires and emergencies, protecting life and property.

questions.question: Why is regulation of construction activities necessary in cities?
questions.answer: It prevents illegal buildings and ensures safety and planned urban development.

questions.question: How does urban waste management affect public health?
questions.answer: Proper waste management prevents the spread of diseases and maintains cleanliness.

questions.question: Why is public transport an important responsibility of urban local bodies?
questions.answer: It reduces traffic congestion and ensures safe and affordable mobility for citizens.

questions.question: How do health programmes of Municipal Corporations help citizens?
questions.answer: They control diseases and promote preventive healthcare in urban areas.

questions.question: Why is environmental protection a municipal responsibility?
questions.answer: Urban activities impact the environment, requiring local action for sustainable living.

questions.question: How do taxes support the functioning of urban local bodies?
questions.answer: Taxes provide financial resources needed to deliver civic services.

questions.question: Why is property tax considered a stable source of revenue?
questions.answer: It is regularly collected from property owners and supports continuous funding.

questions.question: How do State Government grants support urban development?
questions.answer: They provide additional funds for infrastructure and welfare projects.

questions.question: Why do urban local bodies raise loans despite having tax income?
questions.answer: Loans help finance large-scale development projects beyond regular income.

questions.question: How does reservation of seats promote inclusive governance?
questions.answer: It ensures representation of women and disadvantaged groups in decision-making.

questions.question: Why is women’s reservation significant in urban governance?
questions.answer: It empowers women and brings diverse perspectives to local administration.

questions.question: How does local governance encourage citizen participation?
questions.answer: By allowing citizens to elect representatives and raise local issues.

questions.question: Why is accountability important in urban local bodies?
questions.answer: Accountability ensures responsible use of public funds and efficient service delivery.

questions.question: How does decentralisation improve urban administration?
questions.answer: It brings decision-making closer to citizens, improving responsiveness.

questions.question: Why is planning essential for solving urban problems?
questions.answer: Planned development helps manage housing, transport and sanitation issues.

questions.question: How do urban local bodies contribute to economic growth?
questions.answer: They support infrastructure and services needed for business and employment.

questions.question: Why are rules and regulations important for city life?
questions.answer: They ensure order, safety and proper use of urban resources.

questions.question: How does coordination between officials and elected representatives help governance?
questions.answer: It balances administrative efficiency with democratic decision-making.

questions.question: Why is transparency necessary in urban administration?
questions.answer: Transparency builds public trust and prevents misuse of power.

questions.question: How do civic services affect the quality of urban life?
questions.answer: Efficient services ensure health, safety and comfort for residents.

questions.question: Why is citizen awareness important for effective urban governance?
questions.answer: Informed citizens can participate actively and hold authorities accountable.

questions.question: How does urban governance differ from rural governance?
questions.answer: Urban governance manages complex services due to higher population density.

questions.question: Why is regular maintenance of infrastructure necessary in cities?
questions.answer: Continuous use causes wear, requiring maintenance to ensure safety and efficiency.

questions.question: How do local laws help control urban growth?
questions.answer: They regulate construction, land use and public safety.

questions.question: Why is public health a priority for urban local bodies?
questions.answer: Dense populations increase health risks, requiring strong preventive measures.

questions.question: How does efficient governance reduce urban problems?
questions.answer: It ensures timely solutions to housing, traffic and sanitation issues.

questions.question: Why is coordination with the State Government necessary for urban bodies?
questions.answer: State support provides legal authority and financial assistance.

questions.question: How does urban governance support social welfare?
questions.answer: By implementing schemes for health, education and vulnerable groups.

questions.question: Why is local leadership important in cities?
questions.answer: Local leaders understand city-specific issues and citizen needs.

questions.question: How do urban local bodies contribute to disaster management?
questions.answer: They provide emergency services and coordinate relief efforts.

questions.question: Why is long-term urban planning necessary?
questions.answer: It prepares cities for future population growth and challenges.

questions.question: How does citizen feedback improve urban administration?
questions.answer: It helps authorities identify problems and improve services.

questions.question: Why is efficient financial management important for urban bodies?
questions.answer: It ensures optimal use of resources and sustainable development.

questions.question: How does urban governance reflect democratic values?
questions.answer: Through elected representation, participation and accountability.

questions.question: Why are urban local government bodies vital for daily civic life?
questions.answer: They manage essential services that affect citizens’ everyday lives.

questions.question: What overall role do urban local government bodies play in city development?
questions.answer: They ensure planned growth, service delivery and democratic participation.
